website_summaries.verdict: The Roku 4 adds 4K video streaming support and some useful interface tweaks for the company's most powerful media streamer yet. But the price is a bit higher than we're used to seeing from Roku.

customer_reviews.title: Not working and poor support.
customer_reviews.text: The Roku 4 worked wonderfully for about a week, then went totally dead. I called support and they put me through a bunch of "tests" to make sure it was dead, which I had already done. This took me beyond a month for the purchase, and when they agreed to replace it they refused to pay postage because it was "beyond a month of purchase". Amazon would also not take it for the same reason, An Amazon supervisor was supposed to call me the same day, and it is going on the fourth day. So I have a useless piece of electronics sitting here. This is the first bad review I have done of a product on Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: D. Faulk

customer_reviews.title: I am glad I did
customer_reviews.text: Had this unit for 2 months now. Was considering buying roku 3 or roku4 and went with roku 4 for 4k capability. I am glad I did. 4k streaming from this device looks beautiful. I was worried about the noisy fan and hot unit that other people reported when buying roku4 but went ahead and bought it. I do not hear any abnormally high fan noise. In fact the unit runs very quite. Also it only gets as hot as my other roku which is roku2. Remote finder is a nice addition. No hidden remote anymore. Like roku2 set up is a breeze. My only complaint is for this price they could have included the HDMI cable.
customer_reviews.author: John michael

customer_reviews.title: garbage
customer_reviews.text: this is the biggest piece of garbage ever. when it works, it works wonderfully. however, getting it to turn on and/or respond without rebooting it is impossible. then, the sound won't work. i'll have to reboot it, again, and pray that it works. i checked to make sure the firmware was up-to-date and followed all the troubleshooting advice with no luck with this device. i have an older roku stick that works flawlessly, so i had high expectations for the roku 4.
customer_reviews.author: kmdk

customer_reviews.title: Others had it worse where it would not work at all
customer_reviews.text: Works well. One quirk, that I have seen in other reviews/forums is that returning from standby is an issue, even if one of these compatible TV sets is used. I expect at some point that there will be again a firmware update that addresses that, but I have had intermittent luck turning the Roku back on from standby using the Roku remote or have it driven by the TV (selecting the Roku as source). Others had it worse where it would not work at all, again others don't seem to have that problem at all... But content and streamingwise, if there is a good connection (even wireless) it works very well.
customer_reviews.author: JackD

customer_reviews.title: Yes, it's noisey!
customer_reviews.text: Well, I was hoping all the comments regarding fan noise were just overblown. They aren't. This is a very loud unit, even behind the glass of my a/v cabinet. I haven't put a meter on it, but it sounds twice as loud as the 4" cooling fan I use at the back of the cabinet. You can definitely hear this Roku across the room 20+ feet away! I am tempted to return it at this point... but hopefully some sort of fix from Roku soon. I've really enjoyed their products in the past. :( All other functions are great, and it is nice they tried to upgrade the HW to include cooling. They just didn't pull it off very well.
customer_reviews.author: dts007

customer_reviews.title: Excellent however (a little technical)...
customer_reviews.text: Works great, easy install, lots of programming... BUT, if buying this to simply get your 4k content BEWARE, only supports 4k for tvs with UltraHD 2.2 (think its called hcdp2.2). Most 4K tvs don't support this port. Certainly all but 1 or 2, 4k tvs before 2015 have this port. The special port is mostly gov't mandated for Digital Right Management (DRM). There are devices to trick the roku to think it's getting 2.2 and converting to the standard HDMI. These devices are available online for about $100
customer_reviews.author: secbnc

customer_reviews.title: Shockingly mixed review
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Provided an outstanding picture when it was playing movies in UHD on my 75" UHD Samsung during the first 6 months I was the first man-child on the block to get a 4 and friends, allies and frenemies were all jealous of my picture clarity It provides an invigorating jolt when touched It fries an egg faster than an electric griddle Cons: App streaming degraded Extreme overheating Problems with remote connectivity An electric shock every time one touches the device is unhealthy to children and small pets My other older Rokus have been bulletproof (Stick, a 2 and a 3) and Roku is now replacing the device, hopefully just got a lemon
customer_reviews.author: B-Ro

customer_reviews.title: Garbage! On my second one and no difference - picture cuts out CONSTANTLY and nothing fixes it
customer_reviews.text: Apparently, there is a known issue with the video card overheating. I have to assume that's the reason the images cut in and out to make viewing anything virtually impossible. Had the same issue with the first one I'd bought, but nothing fixes it. The issue does not lie within the cords (tried several different HDMI cords and ports), it is not the streaming (the feed will continue whether visible or not), so I'm left to assume that it can only be the Roku itself. I have a Roku 3 and never had any issues. Returning this product for the SECOND TIME - Absolute garbage! Buyer beware!
customer_reviews.author: Mindy

customer_reviews.title: I loved Roku 3
customer_reviews.text: Roku 4 frequently freezes. The sound periodically stops working for extended periods of time. The remote burns through batteries. Response time is slow. The only redeeming quality of this device over any other Roku streamer is that it streams in 4k, but that is hardly a desirable trade-off given the many annoying problems that eventually made me not want to use the device. I feel duped.
customer_reviews.author: Seth M

customer_reviews.title: I bought the updated Roku and in of itself it ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought the updated Roku and in of itself it works as advertised....except....the remote on this unit worked for 1 week and then stopped working. No amount of pairing, battery changing or manipulations via the internet fixes on this ever made it work. I went to the android app to control it which is actually cumbersome. There is no end to the number of complaints about this remote problem on the internet and seems not to ever been really fixed by Roku. I would suggest to anyone (and have) move on to the fire stick from this product as it is just flaky.
customer_reviews.author: MK

customer_reviews.title: Perfect, especially if you find a good deal on it. The 'Roku that does everything'.
customer_reviews.text: A HUGE upgrade from our Roku XDS -- it has all of what we need. USB, 5ghz WiFi (so much better than 2.4ghz when you're in a crowded urban area), ethernet, and really good speed. The voice search on the remote is better than expected. Did I mention that it was fast? The movie starts playing before you even push play. As well, it accommodates our older 720p projector (120" or so). It's perfect.
customer_reviews.author: p. kop

customer_reviews.title: Not entirely happy with the product - lookup Roku remote issues.
customer_reviews.text: Not entirely happy with the product! From freezing screens at 200 MBPs connection to quickly draining batteries of the remote, Roku has been giving me a lot of problems and with Chromecast evolving, NVidia Shield 2017 costing $199 and TV having apps built into them I am not sure if investing in buying a Roku makes any sense anymore. The customer service is good and they are sending me a replacement for the remote but I am waiting for the next google home that casts stuff to chromecast and build-in apps to remove disrupt this piece of tech!
customer_reviews.author: Arjun Gupta

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware...trouble trouble trouble
customer_reviews.text: It a Roku dislike. Nothing but trouble. Kicks us off shows. Loads slow. Doesn’t recognize WiFi connection all the time. We have excellent internet connection so it’s not that. It’s not the tv we have it set up with because it doesn’t matter what tv we connect to it’s the same issues. I wouldn’t recommend a Roku ever!! Roku customer service is horrible. Rude and standard help is let’s reboot to factory. Every time you reboot you have to load all your channel apps again. That’s the consuming and frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: shopper girl

customer_reviews.title: I read many bad reviews where people complained about the fan
customer_reviews.text: I read many bad reviews where people complained about the fan. I ordered one anyway because we have been very satisfied with other Roku products and we have a Roku 4 TV and wanted the most current one, We set it up today and it works beautifully and I can't hear any fan noise well except from me. I am a fan and very happy, indeed.
customer_reviews.author: jnielsen112

customer_reviews.title: Problems with remote
customer_reviews.text: We've had multiple Roku streaming devices throughout our house for years. When the living room one needed to be replaced we bought this one since it was the most recent release. The find your remote feature is nice but is entirely pointless when the system constantly freezes. I don't know if it's because we have multiple devices in our house, but the remote constantly loses its connection to the player so it is basically just a paperweight. Instead, my husband and I both use our smartphones as the remote for the Roku 4. We haven't had any of these issues with the streaming stick or Roku 2s.
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: Lip synch issues are unacceptable
customer_reviews.text: I like the Roku interface but the lip synch issues that so many have complained about make the Roku 4 useless. I've reached out to Roku support with no help. I've tried every setting on the Roku and on my AV equipment but nothing helps. My chromacast dongle works flawlessly through the same AV setup ... I was hoping to use the Roku to watch my Amazon Prime content (seeing Amazon and Google are at war and Amazon won't allow casting). Going to return the Roku 4 and maybe try the stick as i've heard its better for lip synch.
customer_reviews.author: onlineshophead

customer_reviews.title: After deleting channels like Feeln, Smithsonian
customer_reviews.text: The Roku 4 is small, works nearly flawlessly, and the software UI is well-designed. The reason I am giving the device one star is that in the last two months Roku keeps installing unwanted channels on my home screen. After deleting channels like Feeln, Smithsonian, Sling, and NBA, and rating these channels one star on Roku's own internal system, Roku re-nstalls these channels and more back on my home screen. It gets old fast. I've contacted customer support, but they just gave instructions for how to remove unwanted channels. They will not acknowledge that there is a problem with the Roku server loading and reloading unwanted content. I've spoken to other Roku owners: all report the same issue.
customer_reviews.author: Anna Zaigraeva

customer_reviews.title: Hammina, Hammina, Hammina
customer_reviews.text: I have a 3rd-generation Apple TV, and Roku 3. Now a Roku 4 and an Amazon Fire box in transit. The Roku 4's quad core processor makes things go flow smoothly and quickly. The 4K was supposed to be so crisp, I bought a 4K TV to go with it. I hooked up the Roku 4 Ultra to it, and the video is so sharp, it is impressive. My TV came with Chromecast, and the Roku 4 makes it look like below-720p quality. But things pop on the Roku 4. I just wished Roku would come up with a newer template for navigation.
customer_reviews.author: RobbyD

customer_reviews.title: ROKU 4 sucks
customer_reviews.text: Got the unit in August, bought it because of extra features, this week after warranty expired the unit stopped working, connected a fire tv stick video works fine, roku 4 no video no audio pilot led flickers when remote is used but other than that useless... buy roku 3 instead, my friends had it for years without any problem. Maybe I'll target practice with the Roku4 next weekend and post it in you tube. will stick to the Amazon fire tv stick... :(
customer_reviews.author: Richard Z.

customer_reviews.title: Works great, but I'm very disappointed in the apps available ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great, but I'm very disappointed in the apps available for Roku. I chose a Roku, because of the extensive app library, but the library isn't half as large as Roku makes it seem. Of the few hundred apps present at least half are for periodic live-streaming only public access tv type content. Many features included for free on other players require a subscription channel (app). Roku must make it easy and low cost to create channels. On balance, there are a lot of channels with periodic content from local non-profile organizations like churches and charities. Plays 1080p H.265 encoded files well. I also had no problem playing 16Mbps 4K H.264 streams without jitter during pan shots.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Woods

customer_reviews.title: Worse than the 3
customer_reviews.text: Constantly re-booting this POS. Locks up while streaming, sometimes after only a few minutes. Does not matter what app. We have 60-80mb download speeds, zero excuse there. *Never* had to do this with my Roku 3. Improvement? NOT. The 4 is also massive and just plain ugly. Buy the 3 before they sell out.
customer_reviews.author: Claire Burke

customer_reviews.title: Gave up working way too soon
customer_reviews.text: Purchased October 27. Arrived quickly, had easy set up. Now, just over 4 months later, it refuses to work. I have run every troubleshooter and tried several different cables, etc. Not matter what, the tv doesn't know it's there. The tv does recognize other devices when added. It actually appears that it never turns on. I have done soft reset, hard reset, different remote batteries, plugged into different plugs, and nothing works. Very disappointed to get so little use out of this product before it died.
customer_reviews.author: Joyce

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy. Freezing issue
customer_reviews.text: Its been a month since I bought this. Frozen and will not start up again. Stays on the Roku screen and continuously reboots. Item has an overheating issue it seems do not buy. Google roku 4 rebooting.
customer_reviews.author: Ace

customer_reviews.title: Loving the Roku 4!!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely loving this thing. My old Roku 2XS was getting a little long in the tooth and would reboot every so often after watching Netflix or live Sling after awhile. Hooked up this Roku 4 and not only is the picture absolutely amazing, it doesn't run hot and it has never once rebooted on me in the weeks of constant use. Really enjoying sling so may pick up another Roku 4 for the bedroom. It's a solid little device too. Feels like a very small computer. Quite impressed. Great price, great product, highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Mack

customer_reviews.title: Quick and Easy Review.
customer_reviews.text: Quick and Easy Review. Well, I had two, both with the same problem. On 1080p they both have video artifacts in them, 720p is good but 1080p is crap. Both units were that way, sent the first one back missed the window on the second so i am stuck with it. it's a little faster but not really worth it because of the video. Don't know about the 4k as my TV does not support it BUT if it can't handle 1080p, then?
customer_reviews.author: Paul E. Seals

customer_reviews.title: It's a Roku, you know it's gong to work
customer_reviews.text: I like Roku and their products, I like my old Roku remote much better. It's not that this one doesn't work, it works fine. But it seems like they went backward in their remote design. But I like Roku all day long, everyone tells me to switch to this or that or whatever else but Roku is my choice for digital entertainment. I do wish Roku stored my passwords in the cloud so when I add an new unit I don't have to setup every channel one by one. They should have a preferences channels and settings attached to your individual account so when you add a new unit or replace one it's all setup.
customer_reviews.author: DMetcalf

customer_reviews.title: Issues with remote randomly disconnecting
customer_reviews.text: Worked well for about a year, but since then we've had constant issues with the remote randomly disconnecting. It happens intermittently, maybe once every week or two. Batteries are fine. I'm sick and tired of needing to Restart the Roku, then use the iPhone app as a remote to be able to navigate to the settings and re-Pair the remote. And that doesn't even always work.
customer_reviews.author: Jim H

customer_reviews.title: I hear good things about the Roku 3 so I may 'upgrade' ...
customer_reviews.text: Roku should fire their QA manager for letting this out of the door. I bought two of these, one for upstairs, one for down. Both of them seem to have problems. I have yet to hear the fans kick in as some have complained. BUT... they take about 15 minutes to boot up. And one has a wobbly power connector port that means its getting returned as defective. I hear good things about the Roku 3 so I may 'upgrade' to the Roku 3. Every company seems to go through issues when they get big enough and it seems to me that Roku 4 is the Windows Me of the streaming world.
customer_reviews.author: Rattyboy

customer_reviews.title: Dosent last, just get the stick version cheaper. Mine is pausing all video ever 12 seconads.
customer_reviews.text: So I have now had this unit for 1.5 years. At first it was ok, however it got hot and the sleep function would not always work, forcing me to unplug the unit to reboot. So now it skips audio and video on Netflix and on our NAS the movies have green line at the top and it just plain locks up. I have always let the fan run to keep it cool even though it made noise. Now its basicly useless, kinds bites.Hoping to use the remote with another unit as I like the headphone function.
customer_reviews.author: rzr219

customer_reviews.title: HDMI HDCP 2.2
customer_reviews.text: This media streaming unit was a breeze to set up. So many app channels available, and a good bit of them are free! The interactive response time is outstanding compared to a game console we had previously used. The wallpaper is easy on the eyes. One-touch microphone on the remote for search options is incredibly convenient. Remote control locator button on the base is easily heard on the remote and so valuable a function as the kids "relocate" the remote from time to time. This unit was a perfect mate to our 4K TV with the HDCP 2.2 support.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Fails on UHD playback
customer_reviews.text: The Roku 4 cannot play UHD video without frequent screen glitches in the form of white or green flashing bars at the bottom of the screen. I am a long-time Roku user so this was a surprising disappointment to me. Customer service has also degraded to the point of long hold times and slow responses to anything that can't be handled by first-level support. I've ordered the Premier Plus. I guess I'll use the Roku 4 as a doorstop since I didn't notice the problem until the 30-day return period had expired. If the Plus doesn't work I'll return it and I'm done with Roku.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Brodie

customer_reviews.title: Roku is the best.  Buy it now!
customer_reviews.text: Lol this is my fourth Roku 4 purchase. I obviously love them and think they are the best. This is really a great product. I use it for Netflix, Amazon Prime, Time Warner TV, ESPN 3, Amazon Music, Pandora and more. I have a ton of smart TVs, but the manufacturers never upgrade the software and after a few years they usually suck really bad. Roku has been around for a long time. They support their products and appreciate their customers. This is a much better product that Fire or Chrome.
customer_reviews.author: TexasNeighbor

customer_reviews.title: Best for long audio run.
customer_reviews.text: This is the only 4K streaming device that allows me to stream the sound over optical fiber PDIF for my projector. I put the Roku next to the projector and run fiber optic to my receiver. I don’t have the ability to use Dolby Atmos but long distance HDMI has been far too unreliable. If the next generation has both video and Audio HDMI then I will switch but this is a wonderful setup
customer_reviews.author: Doctor Stan

customer_reviews.title: Works well, but could be better.
customer_reviews.text: Small but mighty. It works very well. But it is time consuming to set up. I had to sign in to my Netflix, Amazon, Sling, and PBS accounts on each Roku unit. Otherwise, my preferred Roku apps appear on all of my Roku streaming devices. My other beef is that the website is not very user friendly. It seems geared toward selling you add ons rather than allowing you to search for (free) stations that you might be interested in. The categories seem to have hundreds, if not thousands of options, that are not subcatagorized. All of them seem to be rated 3.5 stars...
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne La Crosse

customer_reviews.title: Lots of troubles.
customer_reviews.text: Cannot process High Definition signals. Get constant digital disruption on the screen. It may be a buffering issue, since it mixes video that has not appeared on the screen, yet. Has a problem with Amazon video. it constantly has trouble with sound and video timing. Every video from Amazon requires me to stop the video and back it up a few seconds to get the audio and video to match up.
customer_reviews.author: MLK

customer_reviews.title: Big disappointment!
customer_reviews.text: We’ve had this just over 1 year, using it only about 10-12 times. We’re empty nesters; still working and we’re too busy to watch a lot of TV, but like watching Netflix on occasion. So, Season 2 of Stranger Things is available now and our Roku will not work. It flickers and cuts off within 1-2 minutes after being turned on. Honestly, we’ve maybe used/watched this Roku for about 25 hours...what a piece of garbage and a waste of money! We’re Disgusted!
customer_reviews.author: bebelovesthebeach

customer_reviews.title: The software in this Roku cannot keep up with streaming
customer_reviews.text: For the most part it does what it says it'll do it'll play your TV shows from all the different apps however the reason why I gave it such a low rating is because when it is streaming Netflix it actually has an issue and cannot keep up so constantly flickers the menu screen which is all purple with a Roku design on it. We actually found that the cheaper Roku sticks worked better than this one but needed this one for an older 4K TV. We were so disappointed with this we actually just upgraded our TV
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: Roku 4 is great for cord-cutters
customer_reviews.text: I'm a big Roku fan, I have three Roku devices in my house. I upgraded to the Roku 4 for my projector. It is quite nice and works very well. I do not notice any noise from the fan that is inside of the Roku 4, even though it is only a few feet away from my head when playing. My projector is only a older Sony 720p, so I cannot take advantage of the higher resolutions that the Roku 4 will support, but for the way I use it I don't think that there is anything better on the market at this time. Jeff
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: Love my Roku
customer_reviews.text: I had Roku 2 for the longest time, but then upgraded to the Roku 4 and I love it. I can get all my streaming services and even You Tube in one place and watch on my TV with no issues. It connects easily to Wi-Fi and to the TV via the HDMI port. I also like that I can do a search for a TV show or Movie and it will show me all the streaming channels it is on and the price to rent/buy and I can easily go to that channel from the search screen.
customer_reviews.author: Erin E.

customer_reviews.title: Nice Sewing Room Addition for My Wife
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a non smart TV in my wife's sewing room. We use only OTA TV (no cable) using ROKU as an addition for lack of expensive cable TV. We've used ROKU for years now and even own a ROKU TV loving all the apps available on it. Plex even streams to it letting her watch The Sentinel (her favourite DVD) streamed from one room to the other. Of course Netflix and the others we can't live without. Compared to other ROKU's we've own this one is fast and responsive. Just wish my older ROKU TV was near as responsive as this one. Now I'm jealous of her setup.
customer_reviews.author: AKing

customer_reviews.title: Utter garbage, so save your money!
customer_reviews.text: The quality of this product has gone beyond downhill since my first purchase in early 2010. This item in particular is a fickle b___. It freezes AND restarts itself EVERY time I am watching a program; no matter the app. The remote is also a joke because the sound intermittently cuts out, though the volume control buttons continue to give me the impression that all is well. TF?!? I end up having to take a battery out then put it back to get it working again. Looks like I may have to break up with Roku once and for all and get one of them Alexa joints. UGH!
customer_reviews.author: Adonya

customer_reviews.title: It works great, it just runs too hot.
customer_reviews.text: It works great, it just runs too hot. Be prepared to give this thing plenty of room for ventilation. If you lay it flat it will be almost too warm to the touch on the bottom side. It's a great interface for Netflix, amazon video, and cable TV direct. It supports Plex (a great add-on) and it has it's own video streaming app available to watch movies from your computer hard drive. The voice search function on the remote is better than expected. I bought the Logitech Harmon keyboard to be used with it. The keyboard works great for amazon video and Netflix.
customer_reviews.author: matthew costa

customer_reviews.title: ... I watch television entertainment and this 4 model is awesome. Buy it just to try using the headphones ...
customer_reviews.text: This product has forever changed the way I watch television entertainment and this 4 model is awesome. Buy it just to try using the headphones connected to the remote! But, seriously, this is the Cadillac of streaming players, in my opinion. I LOVE Amazon and Amazon products and my wife and kids have Fire tablets and a phone, I love the Amazon Basics line of products and shop more on Amazon than with any other merchant...online or otherwise....seriously. However, the Fire TV just has not caught up to the Roku yet. Maybe one day it will. I actually hope that it does. But for now, this is the way to go.
customer_reviews.author: The Dirty Duke

customer_reviews.title: I thought I would like to get the 4k version
customer_reviews.text: I'm only giving this One Star because they shipped it to me. This is the 2nd Roku I've had that locks up at 92% when requiring to update their software, not sure why they can't ship it with the updated software. Went through this before with the existing Roku and they had to send me another one, it has been working and still works. I thought I would like to get the 4k version, since my TV is 4K. They were supposed to get back to me with support, but trying to blame my network, haven't heard back. I guess I will return it, but would rather have them send me a working Ultra 4k.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Pizzile

customer_reviews.title: Good for connecting with Ethernet
customer_reviews.text: I bought this particular model because of the ethernet port. We are no longer going wireless in the house. It works well connected by ethernet, however we have been unable to get it to work/get connectivity using an ethernet switch, so unfortunately, to use it we have to unplug everything and connect it directly to the cable modem. Not sure if the problem with the ethernet switch or the Roku. Also, the remote seems easier to use than other models. It might be that we are just finally used to Roku remotes.
customer_reviews.author: GracieLou731

customer_reviews.title: YOUTUBE DOES NOT WORK
customer_reviews.text: It is incredible that a streaming box has an unusable youtube app. If you like youtube BE AWARE this is crap. Every other app is great but youtube is COMPLETELY UNUSABLE. There is no fix, there is no solution it just sucks. This is not you internet, this is not youtube, it is just that rook does not care enough to fix a dam app... Constant freeze, always loading. Just crap.
customer_reviews.author: q072

customer_reviews.title: I haven't tried any of the competitive choices, e ...
customer_reviews.text: I haven't tried any of the competitive choices, e.g., Hulu, but the Roku 4 gives me more choices than I can possibly use. The Roku 3 is cheaper but has no 4K programming capability. But although only currently available in limited quantity, 4K will eventually grow and I'll be able to take greater advantage of it. I originally purchased the Roku 4 for use with a non-4K TV equipped with only one HDMI jack. I purchased a $7 HDMI switch to allow watching both DirecTV and Roku.
customer_reviews.author: azsourdough

customer_reviews.title: The Best Viewer Period!
customer_reviews.text: Love this Media Player! I keep finding more and more channels to watch. There is just not enough time to watch them all. Just have to pick a few favorites and stick to them. With 4K streaming this player is future proof (at least until 8K comes out). I really like the search feature that shows you what channels you can watch the program on. Sometimes the program is free on some channels and they charge you on others. also the microphone search feature works very well also. I have used the find remote a few times (I don't know why other company's do not put this feature on there remotes). Better than Apple and Chrome and fire. Tony
customer_reviews.author: anthony wadie

customer_reviews.title: Roku 4 turns to Roku Brick
customer_reviews.text: I bought 3 Roku 4s when they were first released. 2 of them have now entered the endless reboot loop after a recent update. I have tried unplugging to attempt a restart and also attempted to do a full factory reset. Nothing works. If you Google Roku 4 endless reboot you will see it is a common issue. I have one Roku Ultra that has been freezing and rebooting since the last update. Fortunately I still had my old Roku 3s which seem much more durable and issue-free. Update, our last Roku 4 bricked this week. Our Ultras have been standing up so far.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Smurthwaite

customer_reviews.title: This thing is great. Does everything it says and more
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great. Does everything it says and more. And it's $15 bucks cheaper here than at Sam's Club. Buy it, just make certain you have an available 2.0 or 2.2 HDMI input. Or you won't get the 4K, just regular 1080. Regular HDMI ports won't cut it. Two most excellent thumbs up, very user friendly even for the low tech folks.
customer_reviews.author: Butch Blancq

customer_reviews.title: Low Product Quality and Poor Tech Support
customer_reviews.text: Great while it worked, but it died after 18 months. The only thing their tech support could do was to have me unplug it to restart it, and then to try to reset it. I had already tried both before calling tech support. She then told me that these kinds of things happen with electronic devices. The warranty was for 12 months, so Roku had no obligation to replace it or to defray the cost of a replacement unit. Not only do I have no interest in purchasing another Roku if it will fail shortly after the warranty expires, I have no interest in dealing with a technology company with such poor tech support.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Chmara

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up, smooth operation & clear picture
customer_reviews.text: Amazing, clear & fast reception with no loading time, very smooth. All the apps you could want. Very easy to set up & navigate. The remote is really simple & functional, it even has a headphone jack on the remote so you can listen silently so you won't bother other people & it comes with ear buds. You just plug it in & it works. Have your log in for the apps you want on the menu. Have your mobile so you can set it up by entering codes it gives you on the apps you want to log in to. Just have used it for a couple of hours, but there is so much to explore.
customer_reviews.author: HeadNtheClouds

customer_reviews.title: Thumbs Up
customer_reviews.text: Pros - It is very good product, The quality of the picture is phenomenal and the number of channels is amazing. A lot of them are repeats, but you can find pretty much anything. Cons - he remote design is horrible. The natural spot for the back button is a voice search button and it takes you out of whatever app you are in and takes you to the home page. Very frustrating to have to go back to the app and start over. I hope that they look at reorganizing the buttons because it is annoying. I recommend this over the other options available.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very crappy product. Go with the new Ultra or the 3rd gen "puck". The Roku4 keeps dying.
customer_reviews.text: Had multiple Roku 4 players die. The first 2 have both failed in less than an year. One simply did not start one day. The other started sending key presses (and yes - eliminated the remote, and even factory formatted it) Sadly, this has been the case with friends and family too. We still have the Roku 3 -- no issues, and the Roku Ultra -- again, no issues. Not sure why, but it seems like there is some defect with the Roku 4. I cannot recommend it. Very happy with their other models, but this one was complete garbage.
customer_reviews.author: VP

customer_reviews.title: Sound quality and functionality is awesome compared to running Netflilx through my old Wii system!
customer_reviews.text: Finally got my Roku up and running (the guy in the house didn't want to read directions--but I wasn't in a rush). Previously ran Netflix through my Wii system where the sound quality was pretty awful. The difference in sound quality is fabulous. And the functionality overall is fantastic. Just returned my cable box to Xfinity today. : )
customer_reviews.author: Indigo Girl

customer_reviews.title: Mixed bag
customer_reviews.text: I loved everything about this roku up until the day it died and stopped working, which was one day after the warranty expired! There was no way to fix it on my end, even after doing a hard factory reset. My older roku's have lasted years longer than this model. Do yourself a favor and get the Roku Ultra instead.
customer_reviews.author: J. Iblings

customer_reviews.title: Roku tech help is useless. They talk as if nothing is wrong with ...
customer_reviews.text: I've had nothing but trouble with this since I bought it. It won't power on without pulling out the power cord and putting it back in. Roku tech help is useless. They talk as if nothing is wrong with it. They're not the ones having to pull the unit out of the console everyday! The picture was pretty good when it worked but that doesn't overcome the hassle.
customer_reviews.author: Southern Fireman

customer_reviews.title: Flickers to a black screen with no sound often, several months after purchase.
customer_reviews.text: It started out great for several months, but now the screen flickers black every few seconds. The sound also goes out, so it makes every show unwatchable. It seems many people are having this problem and have been for some time. I've been unable to find a fix.
customer_reviews.author: D. Campione

customer_reviews.title: Terrible product and customer service
customer_reviews.text: Our rosy worked for a little while and then started showing a double screen. Contacted customer service and they were really not willing to help. They finally said they would send a new power cord however it did not fix the unit. Couldn’t get in contact with them again after that. I recommend the amazon fire stick.
customer_reviews.author: Katie Murdock

customer_reviews.title: No more Rokus I'm done with them.
customer_reviews.text: Plugged it in, linked to wifi. The unit automatically uploaded updates, rebooted. Right then the TV went dark and that's all she wrote. Attempts to unplug and reboot, change cable wire etc. yielded no results, unit just went dead. Returned it to Amazon. That's it for Roku for me, it's not the first one I've had problems with.
customer_reviews.author: J. Ingalls

customer_reviews.title: Great for a month.
customer_reviews.text: Worked great until the return period ended. Now I can't get it past the loading screen, and when I can, it doesn't connect to wifi. I will update review if this ever gets resolved. Upgrade, because it is still under the hardware warranty I can choose to pay to send it to Roku and wait for them to send me a new one. After they receive my unit. Which means a couple of weeks of no Roku and paying for the postage. However the did give me the"opportunity " to buy attitional warranty for their crappy product to protect me in the future.
customer_reviews.author: d

customer_reviews.title: Really like the roku 4
customer_reviews.text: I was on the fence about getting a roku 3 or roku 4, I decided to get the 4 because of the faster processing speed since I like to watch a lot of videos from USB drives, I am not disappointed with the roku 4, I think I made the right choice, even though I can't take advantage of the 4k capabilities because I only have HD tv's. Also, just to note, I can hear the fan when it kicks on, but even with the setting turned on for the fan to be allowed to be louder to keep it cooler, it really isn't very loud at all. Noticeable, yes, but nothing obtrusive or distracting in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: C. Minks

customer_reviews.title: Their products are nice and when they work its great
customer_reviews.text: On their site, it clearly shows an extended warranty for US based customers. They DO NOT honor this at all! This info is incorrect all the way around. I was loyal to Roku. I will be moving to another company. Their products are nice and when they work its great. Tech support outsourced to India and they have no idea what they are doing. I had to show the EMPLOYEE of Roku the website where the warranty is stated. I will be buying a streaming device from Apple.
customer_reviews.author: Ross Kimball

customer_reviews.title: BEWARE
customer_reviews.text: BEWARE,after a couple of months using this device, last night after 9:00 pm and while watching the Amazon channel, it Started airing PORN and it keep changing by itself to a channel name BIGO PORN. Be advised that this devices are corrupted and it Needs an INVESTIGATION. This type of issues are UNACCEPTABLE. I will wait and see if this seller sends a reply and we will go by what we will do Next.
customer_reviews.author: FRANCISCO O.CHAVEZ

customer_reviews.title: I like the Roku 4 because it gives you the ability ...
customer_reviews.text: I like the Roku 4 because it gives you the ability to play 4K movies, although 4K playability is still limited. The interface is very similar to the Roku 3, which I've used for several years now with no issues. If you have a 4K TV and want more channel and app options from what your smart TV might already give you, the Roku 4 is a great option. I use Playstation Vue on my Roku at the moment. If my 4K TV had Playstation Vue as an option built in to the channel/apps list, I probably wouldn't use a Roku 4 on my TV.
customer_reviews.author: eARThRIOT

customer_reviews.title: waste of money
customer_reviews.text: I returned it as it won't allow you to add 3rd party software... the "cut the cable" mantra is a con. They've asked you to drop the likes of Xfinity and Direct TV to save money but they just replaced them with other pay for view services. All the free ones are garbage...
customer_reviews.author: Texas Carl

customer_reviews.title: Initial set-up is fast and easy, so you will be streamimg content in a ...
customer_reviews.text: Initial set-up is fast and easy, so you will be streamimg content in a matter of minutes. The dedicated buttons for Netflix, Amazon, etc. are a nice touch and I love the fact you can add/configure additional content as well. Since I don't have a 4k TV i cannot comment to those features, but the speed, color and sound for 1080p streaming is great.
customer_reviews.author: G. Martin

customer_reviews.title: I couldn't be happier with my Roku 4 (or my Roku 3)
customer_reviews.text: I've had no issues with the Roku 4. I know some people have said that it gets really hot but I don't seem to have the problem. For the record, I do have it placed on a wall mounted shelf with plenty of ventilation. In regards to the device itself, Roku is awesome. I use it for HBO Go, Netflix and Amazon and it has worked flawlessly. I also like the fact that it can be accessed over Wifi using Anymote on my tablet/phone. It's also cool that the remote itself has a headphone jack so that you can still use it even if you need to be quiet.
customer_reviews.author: SGR

customer_reviews.title: Is an improvement over the Roku 3
customer_reviews.text: I own the Roku 3 and this Roku 4 is noticeably improved over that model. I don't have a 4k tv yet but the 1080p is good. One thing that pops out to me is the remote. The buttons are so smooth to press over the Roku 3's remote. The Roku 4 is much bigger around and a little thinner. Using a ethernet wire it is lightning fast. Haven't tried the wireless yet.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Craig Chapman

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected - great picture
customer_reviews.text: This Roku does exactly what it is supposed to do. I like the fact that I can use my computer to sign into various video streaming services since entering multiple email and password with a remote is tedious. My only complaint is the xfinity app only works within the household of the xfinity service - I would like to use it when I travel for work. This is an xfinity issue and not a Roku issue. I have bought Rokus before and I will buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence LaFranier

customer_reviews.title: Packaging perfect. Installed easily and works great
customer_reviews.text: Arrived quickly. Packaging perfect. Installed easily and works great. The greatest feature for me is the ear buds that plug into the remote for private listening at night. They work great, except for about an hour one night, when they stopped working. Don't know why. But, I jiggled the thing around a bit and it started working again. Huh? I thought maybe there was a short in the cord. I replaced the ear buds with another headphone set that I knew worked. It didn't work with them either. While playing around with it in frustration, it started working again. It hasn't gone on the fritz since.
customer_reviews.author: Terry Ball

customer_reviews.title: Overheating problem
customer_reviews.text: Product overheats constantly, restarts for no reason, freezes, and loses internet connection. Tried pooping it up on chop sticks to allow air circulation under it, mounted a computer fan to blow on it but still have the same problems. I always liked a Roku but this Roku 4 is a total disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: Amy G. Leblanc

customer_reviews.title: Terrible UX
customer_reviews.text: Terrible power management. Stays on and runs hot and doesn't GO TO SLEEP properly. If you turn it off manually, which is a LONG and annoying process (through the option that is deep inside the main menu) -- because, you know, THERE IS NO POWER BUTTON ON THE REMOTE, it goes off for good. When you want to turn it back ON again, it does NOT turn on from the remote. Does not respond to the remote and just says asleep. Unless you unplug and plug it back in. Contacted Roku, zero support. No twitter team either. 4K quality is great but these little things are extremely annoying.
customer_reviews.author: PixelMaster

customer_reviews.title: Died after One month or so
customer_reviews.text: Connected to my LG uj6300, but died shortly after. My LG also died too! It took ten weeks to get the LG repaired which is done and now I just sent the ROKU 4 back for replacement at my expense for shipping($17). Never had a chance to try it out I cannot give it any Stars at this time. reliability seems to be an issue looking at other reviews too!
customer_reviews.author: Gary K

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy it!
customer_reviews.text: For close to $100 I expected this to last more than 8 months. It died completely and the suppot at Roku said there was no longer suppot for this product. It has a year warranty but the hurdles you have to go through for recompense seem like pole vaulting. VERY dissatisfied with the product and the suppot. My first roku had a decently long life. My second and more expensive one had a much shorter life and this, my third Roku, was the most expensive and had the shortest longevity. Planned obsollescence?
customer_reviews.author: Donna  T.

customer_reviews.title: Copy protection issues
customer_reviews.text: I use this with a 4K tv (Visio) but mostly run 1080p about 95% of the time. Most the time it works get, but every few days I get the dreaded purple screen when I start a new stream. This is a failure in the copy protection negotiation. So far the only dependable way I can recover is to repeat the Roku until the steam succeeds. Sometimes this is just a reboot, but sometimes it takes up to 3 reboots.
customer_reviews.author: JAH-Just a Handyman

customer_reviews.title: Edit: 1 star
customer_reviews.text: Edit. Awful product. I am a humongous fan of Roku 3 and even an advoctor of the Roku stick. However, Roku 4 is simply a bad design. I'm already sending back my second unit because it has overheated and stopped working for days. Now that I am over 30 days from purchase I have to deal with Roku directly as opposed Amazon. This is a mess. If you're going to buy a Roku product, for all that is holy, please buy a Roku 3. Or, better yet, move on to Amazon or Apple.
customer_reviews.author: stuhardin

customer_reviews.title: Great for playing h.265 4k mkv files
customer_reviews.text: Plays 4k h.265 mkv files as claimed, and is one of the few device capable of doing so at full standard bitrate. Will not play 4k to TVs without support for hdcp 2.2 unless you additionally use a hdcp 2.2 to 1.4 down-converter. I am using this in combination with an HDFury Integral ( an hdcp 2.2 to 1.4 down-converter ) and by doing so am able to play back 4k videos to my Seiki se50uy04 without any problems. I did notice that some media files I played on it did not play the embedded subtitles, so unfortunately I cannot use it for playing all of my media files.
customer_reviews.author: David H.

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic concept
customer_reviews.text: Just make sure your buying a new one, " not a refurbished one" as I may have got. Purchased 12 months ago it now has a constant humbar and pops loud enough to blow some speakers. Contacted with seller has been no good at best. Love the Roku Ultra but not sure if I trust an untouched feel, look at, put hands on.Venders that may be Sears and Bucking every chance they can.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: great device but failed after 2 months
customer_reviews.text: I've been a Roku user for a long time and so, I decided to get the newest 4 model, great device but failed after 2 months, it would not respond to the remote commands, I attempted to get support from the Roku chat room and after various troubleshooting attempts, the person on the chat determined that the problem was with my remote and stated that a replacement would be sent to my house between 3 to 5 business days, after 8 days, I decided to call their support line,.they indicated that the remote was being shipped and it was just taking longer than anticipated. Hopefully once I get the remote replacement I won't have anymore problems with it.
customer_reviews.author: ErickNetwork

customer_reviews.title: You buy it broken
customer_reviews.text: I have done some more research on this piece of garbage. There are thousands of videos on YouTube teaching the general public how to "repair" their Roku issues. Really?? Shouldn't a company put out a product that works? Why should anyone pay money for a product that they MUST repair right out of the box? Half my apps on this thing don't run without some kind of glitch. Why reward Roku by buying their broken piece of trash?
customer_reviews.author: FJDR1

customer_reviews.title: This is a much better product than that sold five years ago
customer_reviews.text: This is a much better product than that sold five years ago! We cut the cable, installed an antenna and this jewel, and now have over 50 channels with content we want to want to watch! Setup was so simple - plug and play. I spent some time finding free channels to add to my home feed, and now I'm enjoying TV again. Big plus - 2 months free trial for Hulu plus and Showtime - you only get one week free if you sign up inline! Great quality TV thru the HDMI output so we get 1080p resolution in widescreen!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's been pretty decent. Sometimes the remote doesn't respond and I've ...
customer_reviews.text: It's been pretty decent. Sometimes the remote doesn't respond and I've rebooted the Roku, but recently I think I've discovered that the remote just got unpaired with the Roku. A press of the connect button under the battery door had it working again right quick. The voice search is nearly useless. It's more limited than I imagined. The headphone jack is nice, but doesn't have enough range to quite reach the exercise bike in the next room (Our room is not very big either.) We rarely have need for headphones other than for that, so it's not too useful for me.
customer_reviews.author: J. Hulliberger

customer_reviews.title: both of which were completely idiotic and didn't even read what I wrote
customer_reviews.text: I own a Roku 3, was excited to upgrade to this. Since then I've had audio sync issues across multiple apps (Netflix, Plex, Amazon) where I've never had audio sync issues with my Roku 3. This only happens with the Roku 4 and no other devices (Roku 3, Xbox/PS4, TV apps) all using the same home theater equipment. I've had a ticket open with Roku for over a month with only two responses, both of which were completely idiotic and didn't even read what I wrote. I don't know if I have a lemon or it's a firmware issue.
customer_reviews.author: KB

customer_reviews.title: Bought this product in Feb 2017, It tends to freeze up from time to time and it can get exremely hot, a small fan ??
customer_reviews.text: Roku 4 gets extremely hot, short battery life and unit has a tendency to stall on the regular causing you to either turn off unit or remove batteries .. upon further investigation on the internet, I discovered that remote freezing is common and instructions on how to fix this issue was posted. Now my Roku remote is once again functioning except for the lost remote sound function ?? This forces me to update my earlier review to 3.5 to 4.0 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Frederic

customer_reviews.title: Diligent streaming device
customer_reviews.text: Great upgrade from the ageing and infrequently updated AndroidTV line. Fantastic selection of apps and great support. One of the best solutions if you're not wanting to deal with vendor lock-in; best way to view Amazon Prime Video (unsupported on AndroidTV).
customer_reviews.author: Isaac S.

customer_reviews.title: Too many problems with setup.
customer_reviews.text: Struggled a lot with the setup for the first couple hours but worked okay after reseting unit. I still could not get Amazon Prime so I went back to a chat session with Roku. Found out I originally set up a Canadian account, somehow with a California address, so I was told to delete the Canadian account and setup an American (USA) account. After struggling with this another couple hours, I gave up. I'm sure I could have had it fixed in a couple more hours, but I worry about more future problems. I will return unit.
customer_reviews.author: Donald Charlton

customer_reviews.title: Spend the extra and skip the stick, this is faster.
customer_reviews.text: Way better and faster than the Roku stick. Update: dropped from 5 stars to 2 because the remote drain a the batteries within 2-3 days and we only use it once a night to watch a 1 hour show. Many forums talk about having the same problem with no solution. This thing is costing me a lot of $$ im batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Dunham

customer_reviews.title: Cable tv killer at last
customer_reviews.text: Pretty peppy, much more responsive than my Roku 2 or even my Roku .5 (early version 1 with the boxy less sleek version). I've been a long time supporter of Roku, since before it was publicly known. I think the version 4 is finally becoming a dream realized. I'd recommend Netflix, Amazon prime and Sling with any nooby purchase. If you have an always on pc, having a playon server would let you cut the cable and satellite without regrets.
customer_reviews.author: Saimei Kinjo

customer_reviews.title: Bait and switch with the Remote
customer_reviews.text: The actual Roku streaming works fine but I spent the extra 40 bucks on this one because the Roku 4 is supposed to come with the Roku Enhanced Remote which can control your TV power and volume. When I tried syncing it it said this remote is not compatible. So after a little research I found out this is not the “enhanced quality remote” this is the “gaming “ remote which comes with older models of Roku 2 and Roku 3. Than I tried to call the product support number on the amazon site associated with this product and it was a disconnected Verizon wireless number.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin P Devlin

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Very responsive
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Great product. Very responsive. Cons: Sometimes when resuming from standby I will just get a black screen. Once I unplug the HDMI cable and reconnect the video will come back on. Or, if I turn the Roku on from being on standby for awhile, I will get a No Signal, Detecting, No Signal, Detecting. Eventually, the screen will come back on. Pretty sure it has something to do with HDCP and my T.V. (Dynex 32" 1080p LCD DX-32L230A12) EDIT: Purchased this HDMI cable from Amazon, fixed the No Signal, Detecting problem. The device does get warm but it's not too bad. Can't say about WiFi for I'm using wired Cat 5e.
customer_reviews.author: CottonEyeJoe

customer_reviews.title: The Problem Box
customer_reviews.text: The setup is easy. I like the display and the features it has. As far as operation it was loud. It would ramp up loud to the point we moved it to another room. We also had to make it accessible to unplug it all the time to reset it. The screen would black out of it would forget the remote. Tried using it from the phone app but same results. I talk about it in the past tense because it made a lot of noise chugging along like an engine this morning then stopped. So my experience with Roku has been frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: Slowboogie

customer_reviews.title: Avoid. Runs extremely hot and has to be reset often.
customer_reviews.text: This thing has been running very hot since I started using it. It crashes constantly. Almost every time I go to use it I have to unplug it and plug it back in and even then it will have issues sometimes. I have a Roku 2, 3, and a 4 and the 3 was the best in my opinion. On another note, do not buy any Roku if you are looking to stream from a DLNA server. The app is atrocious. It has very few codecs, a sluggish interface, and the app crashes all the time (on all my Rokus).
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Zero customer service support
customer_reviews.text: My Roku won't come out of the screen saver. When I'd push a button on the remote, the screen would flicker but return to the screen saver. I emailed Roku's customer support and more than 48 hours later, still no response.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Awful Support
customer_reviews.text: I have a ROKO 2 that quite working after 4 months. I bought his one and it was DOA. Their support is terrible. Even though they give you a 1 year guarantee, they will only let you call the support during the 1st 2 months. Then you have to email or use the chat feature, both slow, frustrating and time consuming. When they work they are great. Good luck.
customer_reviews.author: Primate

customer_reviews.title: Works well without issues but I like FireTV UI more
customer_reviews.text: The device works well and I did not find any issues. I bought this mainly for PlayStation Vue app. I personally don't use apps much. I tried both FireTV and Roku4. A few things I noticed between Roku4 and FireTV. The UI of FireTV is simpler; I can find things more quickly. For example, I still can't find the Vue channel grid with Roku4 while in FireTV it is at the top. The quality of streaming is the same for both devices. However, channels load more slowly on Roku4. It took me longer to install Roku4 but this is a one time thing.
customer_reviews.author: Nad

customer_reviews.title: Technical Issues with the Remote
customer_reviews.text: We have 2 of these. We loved the first one so much we got a 2nd for another room. For the 2nd one I was never able to get the remote to pair. I tried the instructions on the support site and spent 30+ minutes on the phone with tech support without success. I am able to use the iPhone app so I can still use the roku but disappointing hat the remote does work since the remote is especially awesome. I ordered a new remote to see if I can get that to work.
customer_reviews.author: Doug Stotland

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good but power saver is not perfect
customer_reviews.text: The Roku 4 is an improvement over the Roku 3 to a small degree. The power saving feature does not work as well as I had hoped. When it shuts off after a period of inactivity, I have had to unplug and replug it in several times to wake it up. The remote does not always wake it up from power save mode. Other than that, it is a nice upgrade. I do not use it with a 4K capable TV, so I can't speak to that, but it is more reliable than the Roku 3 on my 1080p TV.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Cowden

customer_reviews.title: Roku has mind of its own
customer_reviews.text: If you buy this, please buy the extended warranty. I have yet to have one of their players last much longer than a year. Here I am, a little over one year latter and time for a new Roku. Probably time to just use the Samsung TV interface and forget about Roku. Their boxes work very well, but I expect longer than a year or so of life.
customer_reviews.author: S.I.

customer_reviews.title: Family peace is possible through technology. Remote chews through batteries! Get rechargables.
customer_reviews.text: The headphone feature is awesome. Worth it for this feature alone. My wife can watch whatever she wants at night while our son sleeps and I read. My son can watch his morning ration of cartoons without me going nuts. The voice search feature works like a charm. The news feature needs some work. Stories don't load sometimes. It can be frustrating. Biggest hassle is having to log in online for every channel you add to prove you have a cable account. Why can't you load them all and register them all at the same time?
customer_reviews.author: David H. Rudolph

product_meta.title: Roku 4 | HD and 4K UHD Streaming Media Player with Enhanced Remote (Voice Search, Lost Remote Finder, and Headphone), Quad-Core Processor, Dual-Band Wi-Fi, Ethernet, and USB Port
product_meta.description: The future of streaming is here. Brilliant picture quality for 4K Ultra HD & standard HD TVs and powerful wireless for the best streaming experience. The included point anywhere remote offers voice search, headphones for private listening, gaming capability, and even a lost remote finder. Enjoy more than 2,500 streaming channel, offering access to 300,000+ movies and TV episodes, plus games, music, sports, International, kids programming and more. Search the widest selection of channels, get unbiased results, and quickly find the best option or value. Follow your favorite entertainment and get updates when new content is ready to stream.

Easy Access to 450,000+ movies and TV episodes Across 4,500+ paid or free channels, including Netflix, video, Hulu, and PBS kids
Unbiased search across top channels; find where it’s free or cheapest to watch
Free Roku mobile app on your iOS or android phone for handy voice search, sharing photos, private listening with headphones, and more
